subject: RE: [junit] organizing tests, and the setUp() method
msgSnippet: I might have two decendents of my TestCase (i.e. ATest extends TestCase, BTest extends ATest, CTest extends ATest).  Factor out all of the common code into
messageBody:
I might have two decendents of my TestCase (i.e. ATest extends TestCase,
BTest extends ATest, CTest extends ATest). Factor out all of the common
code into ATest.

If you don't want to go this route you could easily have all ten methods in
one test case one pair testing A (with and without SSL), etc.

Here I would like to ask a question... Do you think it would be a desirable
design decision to refactor your class(es) to reflect the first method of
testing? That is have a base class that handles TCP/IP traffic requests and
then two decendents (one that tunnels through SSL and one that doesn't).

-Jason
